description: Police found the bodies after the blaze tore through the three-storey, two family home in Rochester, New York, on Sunday night. Poilice have now taken over the investigation to figure out how it started.
title: Four Rochester people found dead in family home following 'suspicious' fire
title_page: Four Rochester people found dead in family home following 'suspicious' fire | Daily Mail Online
text:
Four people have been found dead following a fire police says is suspicious.
Police found the bodies after the blaze tore through the three-storey, two family home in Rochester, New York, on Sunday night.
David Burroughs arrived at the scene and said his nephew, Michael Adams, was among the victims.
Scroll down for video
Four people have been found dead after a fire in Rochester, New York, that police are treating as suspicious
He told the Rochester Democrat and Chronicle he was a good kid, but didn't know when he had moved into the home.
The three others have not been identified.
The fire started in the staircase between the second and third floor.
It reportedly took 15 minutes to be put out.
One of the residents called 911 just after midnight and was outside the apartment when firefighters arrived.
The cause of the fire and death of the four adults are under investigation by the Rochester police's homicide unit, Time Warner News reported.
Police found the bodies after the blaze tore through the three-storey, two family home. Firefighters were at the scene into the night
